meanings.sent1: The old books in the basement were mildewed and smelled musty.
meanings.sent2: The mildewed walls needed to be cleaned to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The mildewed shower curtain looked like a fuzzy green monster.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt mildewed with forgotten memories, hidden away in dark corners.
meanings.sent5: The mildewed bread on the counter was a breeding ground for mold spores.

meanings.sent1: If you leave wet clothes in a pile, they will mildew quickly.
meanings.sent2: The damp towels mildewed after being forgotten in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent3: The neglected fruit in the bowl began to mildew, much to the surprise of the forgetful owner.
meanings.sent4: His once bright outlook on life began to mildew under the weight of constant negativity.
meanings.sent5: Time and neglect allowed the garden furniture to mildew, blending into the background of the overgrown yard.

meanings.definition: To cause to become affected by mildew.
meanings.sent1: Leaving wet clothes in a closed space can mildew them over time.
meanings.sent2: The lack of ventilation in the bathroom can mildew the shower curtain.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful roommate's habit of leaving food out would mildew anything left behind.
meanings.sent4: His negative comments seemed to mildew the mood of the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The constant rain would mildew the wooden deck if not properly maintained.
